text.p: Morgan Stanley analyst Sylvan Massot cut his rating for Nestle AG, the world's biggest food company, to neutral from outperform Friday.
-- He told Reuters he made the downgrade because of uncertainty caused by rising coffee prices.
-- Massot said that in a simplified scenario Nestle could spend close to four billion Swiss francs this year on coffee if current prices remained in place. It spent 2.2 billion francs last year.
-- Nestle gets about 20 percent of its profits from coffee and coffee products.
-- He reduced his 12-month price target for the stock to 1800 francs from 1880.
-- He cut his estimates for 1997 earnings per share to 96.7 francs from 98.3 and to 106.3 from 109.5 next year.
